1.title: San Francisco
1.plot: Cricket and big wheeling with celebrity chef Michael Mina in San Francisco.

2.title: Brooklyn
2.plot: Special guests Dulé Hill, Jaleel White, and R&B star Jay Sean meet Omar and Andres in Brooklyn for custom sneakers, bowling, and blowing glass.

3.title: Vancouver
3.plot: Omar and Andres ride seaplanes, throw axes, and make sushi with the inventor of the California roll in Vancouver.

4.title: Miami
4.plot: The guys celebrate Andres' birthday in Miami with Cuban cigars, machine guns, a convertible Bentley, a yacht packed with models, and a trip to the hottest nightclub in South Beach.

5.title: Washington DC
5.plot: Omar and Andres uncover some of D.C.'s best-kept secrets, including a hidden speakeasy and an underground Indian supper club.

6.title: Montreal
6.plot: Omar and Andres try urban beekeeping before playing street hockey with two NHL legends: former Montreal Canadiens Sergio Momesso and Stephane Richer.

locations: Brooklyn, New York City, New York, USA
imdb.plot outline: Actor Omar Miller ("CSI: Miami") and fashion designer Andres Izquieta of Five Four Clothing know that the best travel experiences don't come from following a schedule -- they come from following advice. And a good Wifi connection. In each episode of "Weekend Fix," Omar and Andres travel to a different city, using every social networking tool at their fingertips to seek out recommendations from friends, locals, and strangers alike for the go-to hotels, off-the-radar restaurants and can't-miss local experiences that the guidebooks just can't tell you about.
imdb.title: Weekend Fix
plot: Actor Omar Miller ("CSI: Miami") and fashion designer Andres Izquieta of Five Four Clothing know that the best travel experiences don't come from following a schedule -- they come from following advice. And a good Wifi connection. In each episode of "_Weekend Fix_ (qv)," Omar and Andres travel to a different city, using every social networking tool at their fingertips to seek out recommendations from friends, locals, and strangers alike for the go-to hotels, off-the-radar restaurants and can't-miss local experiences that the guidebooks just can't tell you about.
